name: Recurly
description: Add a Recurly Instance to connect your existing recurly account to the Billing Hub, allowing you to manage customers, invoices, and transactions across multiple Elements. You will need your Recurly account to add an instance.

configuration.name: Allow Select Fields parameter
configuration.description: Enables use of global fields query parameter to filter response to only specified fields. This will override any existing vendor functionality on the connector

configuration.name: Api Version value
configuration.description: Used to set recurly's API version. Defaults to 2.5

configuration.name: recurly API Key
configuration.description: The Recurly API Key, obtained from recurly, (i.e. https://{subdomain}.recurly.com/developer/api_keys)

configuration.name: Filter null values from the response
configuration.description: Used to enable/disable filtering of null values from the responses

configuration.name: Default select fields
configuration.description: Generic map used to specify default fields for bulk download and GET /all requests. Each key should be the canonical objectName and values may be specified as a comma-delimited string or a list of strings

configuration.name: Time of Getting Token or Performing Authentication
configuration.description: recurly Time of Getting Token or Performing Authentication

configuration.name: Event poller refresh interval
configuration.description: Set time interval for polling application (in minutes)

configuration.name: Event Poller Resources Configuration
configuration.description: Event Poller Resources Configuration. The configuration is defined via JSON, an example of which is as follows - { "contacts": { "url": "/hubs/helpdesk/contacts", “idField”: “user.id”, “datesConfiguration”: { "updatedDateField": "user.updated_at", "updatedDateFormat": "yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssX", “createdDateField”: “user.created_at”, “createdDateFormat": "yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssX" }, "pageSize": 10000 } }
configuration.defaultValue: {"customers":{"url":"/hubs/billing/customers?where=begin_time='${date:yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'}' AND sort='updated_at' ","idField":"account_code","datesConfiguration":{"updatedDateField":"updated_at","updatedDateFormat":"yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'","updatedDateTimezone":"GMT","createdDateField":"created_at","createdDateFormat":"yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'","createdDateTimezone":"GMT"}},"invoices":{"url":"/hubs/billing/invoices?where=begin_time='${date:yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'}' AND sort='updated_at'","idField":"uuid","datesConfiguration":{"updatedDateField":"updated_at","updatedDateFormat":"yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'","updatedDateTimezone":"GMT","createdDateField":"created_at","createdDateFormat":"yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'","createdDateTimezone":"GMT"}},"plans":{"url":"/hubs/billing/plans?where=begin_time='${date:yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'}' AND sort='updated_at'","idField":"plan_code","datesConfiguration":{"updatedDateField":"updated_at","updatedDateFormat":"yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'","updatedDateTimezone":"GMT","createdDateField":"created_at","createdDateFormat":"yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'","createdDateTimezone":"GMT"}},"subscriptions":{"url":"/hubs/billing/subscriptions?where=begin_time='${date:yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'}' AND sort='updated_at'","idField":"uuid","datesConfiguration":{"updatedDateField":"updated_at","updatedDateFormat":"yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'","updatedDateTimezone":"GMT","createdDateField":"activated_at","createdDateFormat":"yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'","createdDateTimezone":"GMT"}},"transactions":{"url":"/hubs/billing/transactions?where=begin_time='${date:yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'}' AND sort='updated_at'","idField":"uuid","datesConfiguration":{"updatedDateField":"updated_at","updatedDateFormat":"yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'","updatedDateTimezone":"GMT","createdDateField":"created_at","createdDateFormat":"yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'","createdDateTimezone":"GMT"}}}

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: The orderBy clause, either asc or desc. Valid fields are `updated_at` and `created_at`.  An example sort would be `updated_at asc`. Defaults to `created_at desc`

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: The CEQL search expression. A valid query would be: `begin_time = '2017-04-10T16:02:04Z' and state = 'active'` to search for active accounts created after April 10th

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of resources to return in a given page

parameters.name: nextPage
parameters.description: The cursor value received in the header will give the next page results

parameters.name: accounts
parameters.description: The body to create new accounts

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The accounts code

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The account ID (account_code)

parameters.description: The accounts code
